space_setting_social_ad_decs: Haga clic aquí para obtener más información
client_meta_label_desc: APITable - a data productivity platform that helps you manage your work data more efficiently
api_panel_md_python_example:
## Initialize SDK [![github]({{ githubIcon }})](https://github.com/apitable/apitable-sdks)

```python
from apitable import Apitable
apitable = Apitable("{{ apiToken }}")
datasheet = apitable.datasheet("{{ datasheetId }}", field_key="{{ fieldKey }}")
```

{{ fieldNameTips }}
<!--split-->

## Get records

```python
# Returns all records
records = datasheet.records.all()
for record in records:
  print(record.json())

# Returns the records from a specific view
records_via_view = datasheet.records.all(viewId="{{ viewId }}")
# Get one record (if there are more than one records in the result, return the first record); It's recommended to get one record by its recordId.
one_record = datasheet.records.get({{ pyGetParams }})
# Returns the records that matches the given condition. If you don't give any condition, it returns all records.
records = datasheet.records.filter({{ pyGetParams }})
```
<!--split-->

## Add records
```python
# Add one record
row = datasheet.records.create({{ addParams }})
# Add multiple records
records = datasheet.records.bulk_create({{  bulkAddParams }})

```
<!--split-->

## Update records
```python
row = datasheet.records.get({{ pyGetParams }})

# Update one record
row.{{ oneFieldKey }} = {{ oneFieldValue }}
## row.save()

# Update multiple records
row.update({{ updateParams }})

```
<!--split-->

## Delete records
```python
record = datasheet.records.get({{ pyGetParams }})
# Delete one record
record.delete()
# Delete the records that matches a specific condition
datasheet.records.filter({{ pyGetParams }}).delete()
# Delete the records by recordIds
datasheet.delete_records({{ recordIds }})
```
<!--split-->

## Upload attachments

```python
_file = datasheet.upload_file(<local/web_filepath>)
record.{{ attachFieldName }} = [_file]
```
api_panel_md_curl_example:
<!--split-->

## Get records

```shell
curl "{{ apiBase }}/fusion/v1/datasheets/{{ datasheetId }}/records?viewId={{ viewId }}&fieldKey={{ fieldKey }}" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer {{ apiToken }}"

```

### Returned data example

```json

{{ response }}

```

### Other parameters and tips
```js
/**
* Note: The maximum concurrent access to data for each APITable is limited to 5 times per second
* All configurable parameters can be sent through URL Query Params,
*/
{
  /**
   * (Optional) View ID. Defaults to the first view in the APITable. The request will return the filtered/sorted results in the view, and you can use the fields parameter to filter unnecessary field data
   */
  viewId: 'viewId1',
  /**
   * (Optional) Specifies the page number of the pagination, which is 1 by default and is used in conjunction with the parameter pageSize.
   */
  pageNum: 1,
  /**
   * (Optional) Specify the total number of records returned per page, default is 100. This parameter only accepts integers from 1-1000.
   */
  pageSize: 100,
  /**
   * (Optional) Sorts the records of the specified dimensional table. An array of "sort objects". Supported order: 'asc' and reverse order: 'desc'. Note: The sorting criteria specified by this parameter will override the sorting criteria in the view.
   */
  sort: [{ field: 'field1', order: 'asc' }],
  /**
   * (Optional) An array of recordIds. If this parameter is attached, returns the records array specified in the parameter. The return values are sorted in the order of the passed array. Filtering and sorting are ignored at this time. No pagination, up to 1000 records can be queried each time
   */
  recordIds: ['recordId1', 'recordId2'],
  /**
   * (Optional) Specify the field to return (the default is the field name, and it can also be specified as the field Id by fieldKey). If this parameter is attached, the returned record collection will be filtered, and only the specified fields will be returned.
   */
  fields: ['title', 'detail', 'Number of references'],
  /**
   * (Optional) Use formulas as filter conditions to return matching records. Visit https://help.apitable.com/docs/guide/tutorial-getting-started-with-formulas to learn how to use formulas
   */
  filterByFormula: '{Number of references} >  0',
  /**
   * (Optional) Limit the total number of records returned. If this value is less than the actual total number of records in the table, the total number of records returned will be limited to this value.
   */
  maxRecords: 5000,
  /**
   * (Optional) Cell value type, the default is 'json', when 'string' is specified, all values will be automatically converted to string format.
   */
  cellFormat: 'json',
  /**
   * (Optional) Specifies the query of the field and the returned key. By default the column name 'name' is used. When specified as 'id', fieldId will be used as the query and return method (using id can avoid the problem of code failure caused by the modification of the column name)
   */
  fieldKey: 'name',
}
```

<!--split-->

## Add records
```shell
curl -X POST "{{ apiBase }}/fusion/v1/datasheets/{{ datasheetId }}/records?viewId={{ viewId }}&fieldKey={{ fieldKey }}"  \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer {{ apiToken }}" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data '{
  "records": {{ records }},
  "fieldKey": "{{ fieldKey }}"
}'

```

### Returned data example

```json
{{ response }}
```

### Other parameters and tips

The add interface receives an array value, and can create multiple records at the same time, and a single request can create up to 10 records

<!--split-->

## Update records
```shell
curl -X PATCH "{{ apiBase }}/fusion/v1/datasheets/{{ datasheetId }}/records?viewId={{ viewId }}&fieldKey={{ fieldKey }}" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer {{ apiToken }}" \
  -H "Content-Type: application/json" \
  --data '{
  "records": {{ records }},
  "fieldKey": "{{ fieldKey }}"
}'
```
### Returned data example

```json
{{ response }}
```


### Other parameters and tips

The update interface receives an array value, which can update multiple records at the same time, and a single request can update up to 10 records
Special attention: update will only update the data under the fields you passed in, and will not affect the data that is not passed in. If you need to clear the value, please pass in null explicitly


<!--split-->

## Delete records
```shell
curl -X DELETE "{{ apiBase }}/fusion/v1/datasheets/{{ datasheetId }}/records?{{ deleteParams }}" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer {{ apiToken }}"

```

### Returned data example
```json
{
  "code": 200,
  "success": true,
  "message": "success"
}
```

### Other parameters and tips

The delete interface receives an array value, which can delete multiple records at the same time, and a single request can delete up to 10 records
<!--split-->

## Upload attachments

```shell
curl -X POST "{{ apiBase }}/fusion/v1/datasheets/{{ datasheetId }}/attachments" \
  -H "Authorization: Bearer {{ apiToken }}" \
  -H "Content-Type: multipart/form-data" \
  -F "file=@{your file path};"
```
### Returned data example

*Tips: After uploading, please write the data in data to the attachment cell as soon as possible, otherwise the attachment link may become invalid*

```json
{
  "code": 200,
  "success": true,
  "message": "success",
  "data": {
    "id": "atcPtxnvqti5M",
    "name": "6.gif",
    "size": 33914,
    "mimeType": "image/gif",
    "token": "space/2020/09/22/01ee7202922d48688f61e34f12da5abc",
    "width": 240,
    "height": 240,
    "url": "https://s1.apitable.com/space/2023/02/09/ed97d84948c648498f6b36b1b769071f"
  }
}
```

section6_desc: APITable, not a spreadsheet, is a new generation of data productivity platform. The creator of multi-dimensional tables, achieves the in-depth customization of enterprise/team systems without coding. As the "next necessary skill for the workplace", it is easier to use than Excel and more practical than Python. APITable can achieve:
bronze_grade_desc: Suitable for individuals or teams who are new to APITable
function_t_summary: Si el parámetro es texto, se devuelve el parámetro, de lo contrario está vacío.
function_substitute_summary:
Replaces occurrences of old_text with new_text.
You can optionally specify an index number (starting from 1) to replace just a specific occurrence of old_text. If no index number is specified, then all occurrences of old_text will be replaced.
function_search_summary:
Searches for an occurrence of stringToFind in whereToSearch string starting from an optional startFromPosition. (startFromPosition is 0 by default.) If no occurrence of stringToFind is found, the result will be empty.
Similar to FIND(), though FIND() returns 0 rather than empty if no occurrence of stringToFind is found.
function_replace_summary:
Replaces the number of characters beginning with the start character with the replacement text.
(If you're looking for a way to find and replace all occurrences of old_text with new_text, see SUBSTITUTE().)
function_mid_summary: Comienza a extraer la subcadena del carácter de conteo desde donde.
function_find_summary: Encuentra una referencia a la cadena tofind, en la que la cadena tosearch comienza con la startfromposition opcional. (por defecto, startfromposition es 0.) si no se encuentra la cadena tofind, el resultado será 0.

function_last_modified_time_summary: Devuelve la fecha y hora de la última modificación realizada por el usuario en un campo no calculado de la tabla. Si solo se preocupan por los cambios realizados en un campo específico, se pueden incluir uno o más nombres de campo, y la función solo devuelve la fecha y hora de los últimos cambios realizados en cualquier campo especificado.

err_field_group_tip: Se encontró un error en la configuración del campo. El Grupo no funciona por el momento.
function_arrayjoin_summary: Use separadores para conectar la matriz de elementos agregados a una cadena.
function_arrayflatten_summary: Aplanar la matriz eliminando cualquier anidación de la matriz. Todos los proyectos se convierten en elementos de una sola matriz.
function_arraycompact_summary: Eliminar cadenas vacías y valores nulos de la matriz. Conserva "falso" y una cadena que contiene uno o más caracteres en blanco.
function_and_summary: Si todos los parámetros son verdaderos, se devuelve verdadero, de lo contrario se devuelve falso.
function_arrayunique_summary: Solo se devuelve el elemento único de la matriz.
function_err_invalid_field_name: ¿Nombre de columna o función no válido: / ¿ Field id?
function_example_usage:
Quoting the Column: {Columns name} 
Using operator: 2 * 5 
Using function: AVERAGE({Number Columns 1}, {Number Columns 2}) 
Using IF statement: IF(logical condition, "value 1", "value 2 ")
function_is_same_summary: Compare las dos fechas como una unidad y determine si son las mismas. Si es así, devuelve 1 y si no, 0.
function_is_before_summary: Determinar si [date1] es anterior a [date2]. Si es así, devuelve 1 y si no, 0.
function_is_after_summary: Determinar si [date1] es más tarde que [date2]. Si es así, devuelve 1 y si no, 0.
function_or_summary: Si alguno de los parámetros es verdadero, se devuelve verdadero.
function_xor_summary: Si el número impar de parámetros es verdadero, se devuelve true.

api_panel_type_desc_member: Devuelve una matriz de objetos de unidad. La unidad describe los roles en el espacio, como miembros o equipos. El "tipo" tiene dos valores: 1 representa al equipo; 3 miembros representativos.
api_panel_type_desc_last_modified_by: Devuelve una matriz que contiene un objeto de unidad. La unidad es la última unidad que modifica el registro o especifica el campo. (la unidad describe los roles en el espacio, como miembros o equipos. el "tipo de unidad" tiene dos valores: 1 para el equipo; 3 para los miembros).
api_panel_type_desc_created_by: Devuelve una matriz que contiene un objeto de unidad. Las unidades son miembros que crean registros. (la unidad describe los roles en el espacio, como miembros o equipos. el "tipo de unidad" tiene dos valores: 1 para el equipo; 3 para los miembros).

robot_run_history_desc: Puede acceder a todos los registros históricos de funcionamiento durante la prueba pública https://help.apitable.com/docs/guide/manual-automation-robot#how - comprobar el problema 'target = ¿ Blank \ "> resolución de problemas < a]
password_not_identical_err: "Nueva contraseña" y "confirmar nueva contraseña" deben coincidir
password_length_err: La longitud de la contraseña debe estar entre 8 y 24 caracteres
login_frequent_operation_reminder_conten: Ha ingresado la cuenta y la contraseña incorrectas con demasiada frecuencia, vuelva a intentarlo en 20 minutos
password_pattern_err: La contraseña debe incluir números y letras
confirmation_password_reminder: Vuelva a introducir la nueva contraseña
placeholder_input_new_password_with_give: Introduzca una nueva contraseña que contenga 8 - 24 letras y números
change_password_success: Se restablece con éxito la contraseña
placeholder_input_new_password_again: Vuelva a introducir la nueva contraseña
obtain_verification_code: El Código de verificación no se ha obtenido o ha expirado
phone_email_login: Inicio de sesión por correo electrónico
new_user_welcome_notify: Welcome to APITable. We have prepared a free meeting gift for you to learn APITable. Click here to learn more.
field_map_tips_for_python:
A field name exists that does not match the variable rules, please turn on "Use FieldId" or the code example below may not work! 
[Field Mapping](https://github.com/apitable/apitable-sdks/tree/develop/apitable.py#field-mapping) can help you to solve this problem.
